ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., ''Thinking of your entire lifetime'' or ''Since April 1, 2020''

ElementDescription: Do you think taxes on alcoholic beverages should be increased, decreased or remain the same?
Notes: 1 = Increased; 2 = Decreased; 3 = Remain the same; 99 = Refused/no answer

ElementDescription: Do you think alcoholic beverages should be available in corner stores? (''Corner store'' refers to any small neighborhood store, including convenience stores such as 7-11, but does not include full service grocery stores.)
Do you think alcohol and drug treatment programs should be covered by everyone's health care insurance?
Which of the following health conditions do you think can result from drinking too much alcohol? Cancer
Which of the following health conditions do you think can result from drinking too much alcohol? Diabetes
Which of the following health conditions do you think can result from drinking too much alcohol? Hypertension
Which of the following health conditions do you think can result from drinking too much alcohol? Depression
